message.content:
cs.SY, cs.GT, cs.CE, cs.AI, cs.SI 

The paper discusses the use of bifurcation mechanisms to design optimal control mechanisms and hysteresis mechanisms in two different settings. The first setting involves introducing flat taxation to improve social welfare, which falls under the category of game theory (cs.GT) and computational economics (cs.CE). The second setting involves deriving novel cancer treatment strategies, which could fall under the categories of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and systems and control (cs.SY). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of bifurcation mechanisms to induce optimal equilibrium selection, which could also fall under the category of computational economics (cs.CE) and systems and control (cs.SY). Overall, the paper covers a range of topics that could fit into several different arXiv CS sub-categories, but the most likely ones are cs.SY, cs.GT, cs.CE, cs.AI, and cs.SI (for systems and control and optimization).
